=== Purchase Information === Product Title: G. Review Date: 2012/07/20 Store: Richard Jones (Actor), Blair Underwood (Actor), Christopher Scott Cherot (Director) & 0 more Rated: R Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Richard T. Jones (Guess Who, TV\'s "The Wire"), Blair Underwood (Madea\'s Family Reunion, TV\'s "Fatherhood"), Chenoa Maxwell (Doing Hard Time, Hav Plenty), Andre Royo (Shaft, TV\'s "The Wire"), Andrew Lauren (Conspiracy Theory), Laz Alonzo (Jarhead, The Tenants) star in G, a tragedy-filled story of a young Great Gatsby-ish Hip-Hopper named Summer G who falls for a middle- to upper-class sistah while in college. After she rejects him for a fellow social climber, Summer G spends ten years building a Hip-Hop empire, and then moves to the Hamptons where he finds the object of his affections. Cinematic urban tastemaker movie which highlights an African-American aristocratic lifestyle.', 'Amazon.com', 'G.', 'is an engrossing update of', 'The Great Gatsby', ", set in the Hamptons and starring Richard T. Jones as Summer G., a self-made, millionaire head of a hip-hop label. Having risen from obscurity to make his fortune, Summer pines for just one thing: Sky (Chenoa Maxwell), the woman who dumped him back in college to marry the brutal, philandering Chip (Blair Underwood). Sky's feckless cousin, Tre (Andre Royer), a pop journalist, sets her up in an assignation with Summer, leading to predictable conflicts but with unexpected consequences. Co-written and directed by Christopher Scott Cherot,", 'G.', 'is also an interesting portrait of American wealth, particularly the collision of old and new money in the form of a biracial aristocracy coming to terms with a hip-hop elite. Strong performances alone are enough to recommend this feature.', '--Tom Keogh'] Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Dolby, Multiple Formats, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Judd Landon, Andrew Lauren Productions; G Productions, Chenoa Maxwell, Christopher Scott Cherot, Andrew Lauren, Blair Underwood, Richard JonesJudd Landon, Andrew Lauren Productions; G Productions, Chenoa Maxwell, Christopher Scott Cherot, Andrew Lauren, Blair Underwood, Richard Jones See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 36 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 4.75 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '043396143951', 'Director': 'Christopher Scott Cherot', 'Media Format': 'Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Dolby, Multiple Formats, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 36 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 28, 2006', 'Actors': 'Richard Jones, Blair Underwood, Chenoa Maxwell', 'Subtitles': 'English, French', 'Producers': 'Andrew Lauren, Judd Landon', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: This is a movie to watch when you want to see a bunch of beautiful actors, in an even more beautiful setting, entertaining the audience with a very engaging love story. It is sexy, it is hip, and it is addicting.

My only and biggest complaint is that there is no place to find the music soundtrack. In fact, it is the main reason why I bought this DVD. Haunting and gorgous, I just wish it was available somewhere. Review Title: Guilty Pleasure Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Spirited Away Review Date: 2012/10/08 Store: Hayao Miyazaki (Director) Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Animation Product Description: ['Product Description', 'From one of the most celebrated filmmakers in the history of animated cinema comes the most acclaimed film of 2002. Hayao Miyazaki\'s latest triumph, filled with astonishing animation and epic adventure, is a dazzling masterpiece for the ages. It\'s a "wonderfully welcoming work of art that\'s as funny and entertaining as it is brilliant, beautiful, and deep" (Joe Morgenstern, Wall Street Journal). SPIRITED AWAY is a wondrous fantasy about a young girl, Chihiro, trapped in a strange new world of spirits. When her parents undergo a mysterious transformation, she must call upon the courage she never knew she had to free herself and return her family to the outside world. An unforgettable story brimming with creativity, SPIRITED AWAY will take you on a journey beyond your imagination. "To enter the world of Hayao Miyazaki is to experience a kind of lighthearted enchantment that is unique to the world of animation" (Roger Ebert, Chicago Sun-Times). It\'s a fantastic tale the whole family will want to experience over and over again.~~(c) 2001 Nibariki -- GNDDTM', 'Set Contains:', 'The most interesting extra feature on the two-disc set is the Nippon Television Special on the making of', 'Spirited Away', ', not because it\'s significantly different from American making-of programs, but because the camera crew was allowed to film Miyazaki at work. It\'s fascinating to watch the visionary director explaining how individual movements should be animated, and even performing the little dance the frog-master does to welcome the No-Face to Yubaba\'s bath house. (Old animators describe Walt Disney giving similar performances, but no comparable footage exists.) It\'s also striking to see how intimate Studio Ghibli is, unencumbered by the tiers of management that burden American studios. The scene comparisons enable the viewer to study the storyboards for the film, which Miyazaki draws himself. These simple yet wonderfully vivid images capture the essence of a mood, a movement, an expression. "Behind the Microphone" offers a fairly standard behind-the-scenes look at the creation of the excellent English version of', 'Spirited Away', '.', '--Charles Solomon'] Average Rating: 4.9 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Fantasy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Hayao Miyazaki', 'Language': 'French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), Japanese (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 5 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.57 x 5.3 x 7.52 inches; 4.32 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'UPC# 7869 3621 3843', 'Director': 'Hayao Miyazaki', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 5 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 15, 2003', 'Studio': 'Walt Disney Home Entertainment Presents A Studio Ghibli Film', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: To try and describe this movie is kind of crazy. I mean there's this little girl in a world inhabited by strange and curious spirits who must rescue her parents from a frightening and terrible fate. But the journey is so much more than a simple description.

The animation is just gorgeous, the story is captivating and unique, and the musical score is so haunting and beautiful, you will find yourself remembering the themes long after the movie is over. Please give it a chance and allow yourself to be swept away by this special little film. Review Title: A beautiful, thoughtful experience Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Code Name: Dancer [DVD] Review Date: 2012/10/26 Store: Kate Capshaw (Actor), Jeroen Krabb (Actor), Buzz Kulik (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Action & Adventure Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Format': 'Color, DVD, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Tracey Williams, Al Sapienza, Kate Capshaw, Cliff De Young, Corinne Bohrer, Helen Siff, Buzz Kulik, Jorge Martnez de Hoyos, Garette Ratliff Henson, Krzyztof Waliszewski, Kimberly Kulik, Honorato Magaloni, Jeroen Krabb, James Sloyan, Kurt Braunreiter, Jill Wagner-Porter, Robin Hudis, Andaluz Russell, Francisco Cuevas, Hilary Perez, Guillermo Ros, Valerie Mahaffey, Gregory SierraTracey Williams, Al Sapienza, Kate Capshaw, Cliff De Young, Corinne Bohrer, Helen Siff, Buzz Kulik, Jorge Martnez de Hoyos, Garette Ratliff Henson, Krzyztof Waliszewski, Kimberly Kulik, Honorato Magaloni, Jeroen Krabb, James Sloyan, Kurt Braunreiter, Jill Wagner-Porter, Robi… See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 34 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 4.16 Ounces', 'Director': 'Buzz Kulik', 'Media Format': 'Color, DVD, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 34 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 4, 2004', 'Actors': 'Kate Capshaw, Jeroen Krabb, Gregory Sierra, Valerie Mahaffey, James Sloyan', 'Studio': 'Trinity Home Ent', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: I, like others have written, only saw this movie once many years back - but it stuck with me. It's never been re- broadcast that I could tell and I just figured for the price why not buy it.

There was nothing on tv worth watching so we popped the film in and had a really enjoyable time watching it. In fact it is eons better than some of the garbage currently on.

Great love story, top notch actors and a pretty decent story. For a couple of hours I escaped into a very pleasant movie.

If anyone out there has any influence, please get some network to give this film some air time. If even if its just on the Lifetime channel. I'm certain the viewers would love it. I know that seems weird but as a native New Yorker, I just love the scenes between a mom and her son in front of the most spectacular Christmas Tree in the world. So, there it is.

The movie isn't particularly bad or good. Pretty much the same formula as the first movie with just a few more predictable changes. But I don't mind sitting through it and going along for the ride. I could do far worse. She was interested in yoga but didn't want to make a huge investment until she knew what it was all about. Apparently she is very happy with the program and the instructions. She says that you don't feel a lot of pressure and the pace is perfect for a person who hasn't exercised a lot in their life and wants to gradually get into it. Makes sense to me and if she's happy - then I'm happy for her. Review Title: Seems to be okay Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/05/25 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['John Singleton'], 'Producers': ['Jane Bartelme', 'Jeremy Bell', 'Patrick Crowley', 'Doug Davison', 'Ellen Goldsmith-Vein', 'Wolfgang Hammer', 'Anthony Katagas', 'Dan Lautner', 'Roy Lee'], 'Starring': ['Taylor Lautner', 'Lily Collins', 'Alfred Molina'], 'Studio': ['IMDB Freedive']} Review Text: Even though I found this movie to be somewhat predictable, sometimes it's just fun to let go and enjoy the ride.

The acting is very good, the action and conflict are intense and the film moves along at a quick pace. The story is basically an updated version of the whole "boy on the milk carton" scenario, revised as the "boy on the website". Clever and plausible.

Need something to watch when you're out of options - this film is a good choice for some fueled up energy and an entertaining night at the movies. Review Title: Keeps your attention - entertaining Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/08/10 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Robson', 'Mark'], 'Producers': ['David Weisbart'], 'Starring': ['Barbara Parkins', 'Patty Duke', 'Paul Burke'], 'Studio': ['Crowd Pleasers']} Review Text: Every now & then I just feel like watching something totally mindless and brain dead (not me, the movie!) and this perfectly fits the bill.

The story, the setting, the horrific attempts at acting and the complete unavailability of some type of cohesive editing make this film the ideal candidate for those rainy days when Lifetime Channel is showing something you've seen one too many times. In fact, it's more like horrific success at over-acting that leaves me mesmerized.

Don't worry too much about the story of three young women of the 60's trying to succeed in modeling, film, broadway and love. Just sit back with a chilled bottle of wine, some crackers & cheese, and a couple of hours to give yourself a break and have a totally entertaining afternoon at "camp". Review Title: Total camp, terrible acting - love it! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/09/07 Average Rating: 3.9 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Joseph Sargent'], 'Producers': ['Synergy Ent'], 'Starring': ['Sally Field', 'Eleanor Parker', 'Lane Bradbury'], 'Studio': ['The Film Detective']} Review Text: I hadn't seen this movie since the 70's when it was an "ABC Movie of the Week", but it always stayed in my mind.

The story of youth wanting to run away from the constraints of misguided adults is as old as time. And although the clothes, characters, music and some of the dialogue is a little dated, the feelings are the same. Generational breakdown in communication pure & simple. Everyone has wanted to run away & join the circus at some point in their life.

The acting is what actually sets this film apart from many of that period. A very young Sally Fields, Jackie Cooper, Eleanor Parker, and a sadly under-used David Carradine (pre "Kung Fu") elevate this film.

I think its worth watching & especially since Amazon offers it for free with your Prime membership. A whole lot better than most of the garbage out there right now. Review Title: Worth the trip down Memory Lane Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/05/24 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['William Castle'], 'Producers': ['William Castle', 'Robb White'], 'Starring': ['Vincent Price', 'Richard Long', 'Carolyn Craid'], 'Studio': ['More to Explore']} Review Text: A teriffic old time scary haunted house story complete with clueless guests, skanky wife, possible infidelity, things that go bump in the night and the Master himself - Vincent Price. This is just classic, black & white, shivering in the dark perfection.

Guests invited to spend the night in a possibly haunted house for money are then terrorized throughout their experience. But by whom.., or what?

It may not be as nasty or clever or gory as movies that have come since then, but sit back and just enjoy a little creepy, old-time fun in the dark. Review Title: Scary good fun Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/09/05 Average Rating: 3.3 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Whit Stillman'], 'Producers': ['Whit Stillman'], 'Starring': ['Adam Brody', 'Chloe Sevigny', 'Carrie Maclemore'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Review Text: Quirky, clever, well- acted and thoroughly enjoyable. I hope there 'll be more episodes to come. So far I 've watched this one twice and have been telling everyone I know about it.

This show is too good for tv! Don't miss it! Review Title: Another great reason to get Amazon Prime Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/12/26 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Joss Whedon'], 'Producers': ['Kevin Feige'], 'Starring': ['Robert Downey Jr. Chris Evans'], 'Studio': ['Hit Movies']} Review Text: Plenty of action, terrific performances, often hilarious, and quite simply the gold standard of its genre. The bar has been set - good luck everyone else! When you have great source material, the rest is gravy. Dickerson', 'Patrick Cady', 'Aaron Lipstadt', 'Kevin Dowling', 'Adam Davidson', 'Daisy von Scherler Mayer', 'Tim Hunter', 'Christine Moore', 'Zetna Fuentes'], 'Producers': ['Eric Overmyer', 'Michael Connelly', 'Henrik Bastin', 'Pieter Jan Brugge'], 'Starring': ['タイタス・ウェリバー', 'ジェイミー・へクター', 'エイミー・アキノ']} Review Text: I have read every book by this author (hoping there's a place in the future for a Lincoln Lawyer) and am still totally enthralled with this production. It's never exactly as your imagination conjures it up, but I am totally onboard and relishing every episode.

The thing I admire the most about this program is what an outstanding job they've done at meshing different books into overlapping storylines. It is seamless and terrific.

Bosch is the quality result of allowing and supporting the author to be directly involved with the process. Obviously he knows the material but more unique to this situation is that he also knows and understands "the industry". He knows how to turn a great book into great television.

And that my friends is what is known as a slam dunk. Review Title: An exceptional second season Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

Review Title: Seems to be okay Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/05/25 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['John Singleton'], 'Producers': ['Jane Bartelme', 'Jeremy Bell', 'Patrick Crowley', 'Doug Davison', 'Ellen Goldsmith-Vein', 'Wolfgang Hammer', 'Anthony Katagas', 'Dan Lautner', 'Roy Lee'], 'Starring': ['Taylor Lautner', 'Lily Collins', 'Alfred Molina'], 'Studio': ['IMDB Freedive']} Review Text: Even though I found this movie to be somewhat predictable, sometimes it's just fun to let go and enjoy the ride.

The acting is very good, the action and conflict are intense and the film moves along at a quick pace. The story is basically an updated version of the whole "boy on the milk carton" scenario, revised as the "boy on the website". Clever and plausible.

Need something to watch when you're out of options - this film is a good choice for some fueled up energy and an entertaining night at the movies. Review Title: Keeps your attention - entertaining Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/08/10 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Robson', 'Mark'], 'Producers': ['David Weisbart'], 'Starring': ['Barbara Parkins', 'Patty Duke', 'Paul Burke'], 'Studio': ['Crowd Pleasers']} Review Text: Every now & then I just feel like watching something totally mindless and brain dead (not me, the movie!) and this perfectly fits the bill.

The story, the setting, the horrific attempts at acting and the complete unavailability of some type of cohesive editing make this film the ideal candidate for those rainy days when Lifetime Channel is showing something you've seen one too many times. In fact, it's more like horrific success at over-acting that leaves me mesmerized.

Don't worry too much about the story of three young women of the 60's trying to succeed in modeling, film, broadway and love. Just sit back with a chilled bottle of wine, some crackers & cheese, and a couple of hours to give yourself a break and have a totally entertaining afternoon at "camp". Review Title: Total camp, terrible acting - love it! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/09/07 Average Rating: 3.9 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Joseph Sargent'], 'Producers': ['Synergy Ent'], 'Starring': ['Sally Field', 'Eleanor Parker', 'Lane Bradbury'], 'Studio': ['The Film Detective']} Review Text: I hadn't seen this movie since the 70's when it was an "ABC Movie of the Week", but it always stayed in my mind.

The story of youth wanting to run away from the constraints of misguided adults is as old as time. And although the clothes, characters, music and some of the dialogue is a little dated, the feelings are the same. Generational breakdown in communication pure & simple. Everyone has wanted to run away & join the circus at some point in their life.

The acting is what actually sets this film apart from many of that period. A very young Sally Fields, Jackie Cooper, Eleanor Parker, and a sadly under-used David Carradine (pre "Kung Fu") elevate this film.

I think its worth watching & especially since Amazon offers it for free with your Prime membership. A whole lot better than most of the garbage out there right now. Review Title: Worth the trip down Memory Lane Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/05/24 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['William Castle'], 'Producers': ['William Castle', 'Robb White'], 'Starring': ['Vincent Price', 'Richard Long', 'Carolyn Craid'], 'Studio': ['More to Explore']} Review Text: A teriffic old time scary haunted house story complete with clueless guests, skanky wife, possible infidelity, things that go bump in the night and the Master himself - Vincent Price. This is just classic, black & white, shivering in the dark perfection.

Guests invited to spend the night in a possibly haunted house for money are then terrorized throughout their experience. But by whom.., or what?

It may not be as nasty or clever or gory as movies that have come since then, but sit back and just enjoy a little creepy, old-time fun in the dark. target_interaction.title: Lighten up - it’s a goofy, fun little movie
target_interaction.text:
This movie is quirky, clever & even touching. Never heard of it before I caught it on cable one night and found myself really enjoying the journey.

The acting is wonderful & the creatures are a perfect mix of hilarious and annoying. But more fun than anything else. Sometimes it’s a little uneven but the cast has great chemistry and there is a universal message about family & love.

Look - this movie isn’t trying to be anything but a great way to spend a couple of hours away from all the crap in the world. It is trippy, it is sweet . Maybe not for everyone, but definitely worth a look.
description: When he was a teen-and the planet was being ravaged by an apocalyptic event that caused animals to mutate into giant creatures-orphaned Joel (Dylan O'Brien) promised his girlfriend Aimee (Jessica Henwick) that he'd find her again some day. Tipped to her cross-country whereabouts seven years later, he leaves his survivors' colony to find her-tackling uncanny perils along the way. Engaging doomsday actioner-meets-John Hughes flick co-stars Michael Rooker, Dan Ewing, Ellen Hollman. 109 min. Widescreen; Soundtrack: English.
